articles.headline: ‘Never Trump’ Movement Dealt Setback After Super Tuesday
articles.snippet: With Donald J. Trump winning seven more states, Republican rivals grasped for hope that they could defy history and halt his march to the nomination.
articles.abstract: With Donald J. Trump winning seven more states, Republican rivals grasped for hope that they could defy history and halt his march to the nomination.
articles.lead_paragraph: Alarmed by Donald J. Trump’s victories in seven states on Super Tuesday, Republicans desperate to sink his presidential bid moved on Wednesday to battle him on two fronts, attacking him with millions of dollars in television ads in Florida while girding for what would be the party’s first contested convention in 40 years.
articles.byline: By Jonathan Martin and Maggie Haberman

articles.headline: Aubrey McClendon, Chesapeake Energy Ex-Chief, Dies Day After Indictment
articles.snippet: Authorities said Mr. McClendon, who built a fortune in shale gas across the country, was killed when his car drove into a bridge.
articles.abstract: Authorities said Mr. McClendon, who built a fortune in shale gas across the country, was killed when his car drove into a bridge.
articles.lead_paragraph: HOUSTON — Aubrey McClendon was the face of the nation’s natural gas boom, a swashbuckling innovator who pioneered a shale revolution.

articles.headline: Beneath Hillary Clinton’s Super Tuesday Wins, Signs of Turnout Trouble
articles.snippet: A drop in Democratic primary turnout has reached deeply into some of the core groups of voters Mrs. Clinton must not only win in November, but also draw in large numbers.
articles.abstract: A drop in Democratic primary turnout has reached deeply into some of the core groups of voters Mrs. Clinton must not only win in November, but also draw in large numbers.
articles.lead_paragraph: Hillary Clinton set out 10 months ago to inspire and energize the Democratic Party, hoping to bring together the rising American electorate of black, brown, young and female voters into a durable presidential coalition. But buried beneath Mrs. Clinton’s wide-ranging and commanding victories on Tuesday night were troubling signs of a party that has not yet rallied to her call.

articles.headline: With Bet on Japan, Sharp Stumbles
articles.snippet: The plight of the electronics company is a story of missteps by managers who failed to anticipate shifts in the global electronics industry.
articles.abstract: The plight of the electronics company is a story of missteps by managers who failed to anticipate shifts in the global electronics industry.
articles.lead_paragraph: TOKYO — When flat-screen televisions began replacing boxy analog sets in the world’s living rooms more than a decade ago, few companies bet bigger on the new technology than Sharp of Japan.

articles.headline: New Doubts About ‘Too Big to Fail’ Banks Rattle Foundation of Regulations
articles.snippet: While a vast system of new rules governing bank behavior has arisen, some regulators wonder if enough has been done, and some analysts say the largest banks may shrink.
articles.abstract: While a vast system of new rules governing bank behavior has arisen, some regulators wonder if enough has been done, and some analysts say the largest banks may shrink.
articles.lead_paragraph: Governments around the world have built over the last few years a vast new system of rules that would allow banking giants to fail and shield taxpayers from bailouts.

articles.headline: In Scandal at Puerto Rico Utility, Ex-Fuel Buyer Insists He Took No Bribes
articles.snippet: William Clark led the fuel procurement office at the heart of accusations that the utility overpaid for cheap, dirty oil.
articles.abstract: William Clark led the fuel procurement office at the heart of accusations that the utility overpaid for cheap, dirty oil.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN JUAN, P.R. — The mystery man at the heart of what is being called “a monumental fraud” in Puerto Rico broke his silence this week, answering questions under oath about whether conspirators at the island’s electric utility overcharged residents by hundreds of millions of dollars and worsened the island’s debt crisis.

articles.headline: Saudi Arabia Cuts Billions in Aid to Lebanon, Opening Door for Iran
articles.snippet: Saudi Arabia’s tactic could allow Iran to increase its role in Lebanon through its ally, the militant group Hezbollah.
articles.abstract: Saudi Arabia’s tactic could allow Iran to increase its role in Lebanon through its ally, the militant group Hezbollah.
articles.lead_paragraph: BEIRUT, Lebanon — Even as Iran and Saudi Arabia supported opposite sides in a bitter and bloody proxy war in Syria, the two adversaries managed to preserve a tense calm just over the border in Lebanon, where they have long competed for influence.

articles.headline: Apple Gets Tech Industry Backing in iPhone Dispute, Despite Misgivings
articles.snippet: Silicon Valley appears to be siding with Apple in the San Bernardino iPhone case, overcoming worries about the consequences of an unfavorable ruling.
articles.abstract: Silicon Valley appears to be siding with Apple in the San Bernardino iPhone case, overcoming worries about the consequences of an unfavorable ruling.
articles.lead_paragraph: It is a remarkable moment for the technology industry, with many different companies and organizations rallying around a single company — Apple — in a major legal case against the United States government over privacy and security.
articles.byline: By Nick Wingfield and Mike Isaac

articles.headline: Xi Jinping’s Remedy for China’s Economic Gloom Has Echoes of Reaganomics
articles.snippet: “Supply-side structural reform” represents an effort to rejuvenate President Xi Jinping’s faltering plans to overhaul the Chinese economy.
articles.abstract: “Supply-side structural reform” represents an effort to rejuvenate President Xi Jinping’s faltering plans to overhaul the Chinese economy.
articles.lead_paragraph: BEIJING — With the world looking to China for assurance that it can manage its slowing economy and tumultuous stock market, President Xi Jinping has begun pushing a remedy that sounds less like Marx and Mao than Reagan and Thatcher.

articles.headline: Mitt Romney and John McCain Denounce Donald Trump as a Danger to Democracy
articles.snippet: The last two Republican presidential nominees warned in forceful terms that a Trump presidency would put the country’s political system and national security in peril.
articles.abstract: The last two Republican presidential nominees warned in forceful terms that a Trump presidency would put the country’s political system and national security in peril.
articles.lead_paragraph: A divided Republican Party erupted into open and bitter warfare on Thursday as its two previous presidential nominees delivered an extraordinary rebuke of its current front-runner, Donald J. Trump, warning that his election could put the United States and its democratic system in peril.
articles.byline: By Alexander Burns and Michael Barbaro

articles.headline: Charles Grassley Faces Formidable Challenger in Iowa Senate Race
articles.snippet: Patty Judge, a former Iowa lieutenant governor and state agriculture secretary, will seek the Democratic nomination to challenge the senator, who is seeking a seventh term.
articles.abstract: Patty Judge, a former Iowa lieutenant governor and state agriculture secretary, will seek the Democratic nomination to challenge the senator, who is seeking a seventh term.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Democrats on Thursday unleashed a furious assault on Senator Charles E. Grassley, the Iowa Republican and Judiciary Committee chairman who has become the face of his party’s refusal to hold a hearing on President Obama’s nominee to the Supreme Court.
articles.byline: By Jennifer Steinhauer and David M. Herszenhorn
